column16: Scolymus maculatus is a ANNUAL growing to 1 m (3ft 3in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 7.  It is in flower in July. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers dry or  moist soil.
